name.text: q001 The process of creating and maintaining information systems is called _____

questiontext.text: The process of creating and maintaining information systems is called ________.

name.text: q002 When compared to program development, systems development is ________.

questiontext.text: When compared to program development, systems development is ________.

name.text: q003 Which of the following statements is TRUE of systems development?

questiontext.text: Which of the following statements is TRUE of systems development?

answer.text: It has little need for human relations skills as tasks are performed by individuals and not by groups.
It is a technical task undertaken exclusively by programmers and hardware specialists.
It has lesser scope than computer program development.
It requires business knowledge and an understanding of group dynamics.

name.text: q004 Which of the following statements is TRUE of information systems?

questiontext.text: Which of the following statements is TRUE of information systems?

answer.text: They are off-the-shelf software without adaptation.
They can be adapted to fit business needs.
They can be purchased as off-the-shelf software.

name.text: q005 Information systems cannot be tailor-made.

questiontext.text: Information systems cannot be tailor-made.

name.text: q006 Information systems involve people and procedures, so they can never be off

questiontext.text: Information systems involve people and procedures, so they can never be off-the-shelf.

name.text: q007 What is systems development? How is it different from program development?

questiontext.text: What is systems development? How is it different from program development?

graderinfo.text:
Systems development is the process of creating and maintaining information systems. Systems development has a broader scope than computer program development as it involves all five components: hardware, software, data, procedures, and people. Developing a computer program, on the other hand, mostly involves software programs, with some focus on data and databases.
Compared to program development, systems development requires more than just programming or technical expertise. Establishing the system's goals, setting up the project, and determining requirements require business knowledge and management skill. Tasks like building computer networks and writing computer programs require technical skills. Creating data models requires the ability to interview users and understand their view of the business activities. Designing procedures, especially those involving group action, requires business knowledge and an understanding of group dynamics. Developing job descriptions, staffing, and training all require human resource and related expertise.
Thus, unlike program development, systems development is not an exclusively technical task undertaken by programmers and hardware specialists. Rather, it requires coordinated teamwork of both specialists and nonspecialists with business knowledge.

name.text: q008 Which of the following statements is TRUE of systems development for bigger

questiontext.text: Which of the following statements is TRUE of systems development for bigger systems and longer projects?

answer.text: The diseconomies of scale are reduced.
The changes in requirements are increased.
The average contribution per worker is increased.
The project budgeting and scheduling becomes easy.

name.text: q009 According to Brooks' Law, adding more people to a late project ________.

questiontext.text: According to Brooks' Law, adding more people to a late project ________.

name.text: q010 According to Brooks' Law, which of the following is a consequence of adding

questiontext.text: According to Brooks' Law, which of the following is a consequence of adding more people to late projects?

answer.text: The work allocation per team member increases.
The costs of training new people can overwhelm the benefits of their contribution.
Beyond a workgroup of about 20 employees, economies of scale begin to take over.
It allows the managers to extend the timeline of the project.

name.text: q011 Systems development is easy and risk-free.

questiontext.text: Systems development is easy and risk-free.

name.text: q012 It is essential to estimate a system's cost to calculate its rate of return

questiontext.text: It is essential to estimate a system's cost to calculate its rate of return.

name.text: q013 One of the major challenges in systems development is changing technology.

questiontext.text: One of the major challenges in systems development is changing technology.

name.text: q014 As development teams become larger, the average contribution per worker dec

questiontext.text: As development teams become larger, the average contribution per worker decreases.

name.text: q015 Brooks' Law holds true because a larger staff requires decreased coordinati

questiontext.text: Brooks' Law holds true because a larger staff requires decreased coordination.

name.text: q016 Why is systems development difficult and risky?

questiontext.text: Why is systems development difficult and risky?

graderinfo.text: Systems development is difficult and risky because system requirements are often very difficult to determine. Even more difficult, systems development aims at a moving target. Requirements change as the system is developed, and the bigger the system and the longer the project, the more the requirements change. Systems development also faces difficulties in terms of scheduling and budgeting. It is often difficult to estimate the time taken to build a system. It is essential to determine the cost of developing a system, and if labor hours cannot be estimated, labor costs cannot be estimated. Yet another challenge is that while a project is underway, technology continues to change. Unfortunately, as development teams become larger, the average contribution per worker decreases. This is true because as staff size increases, more meetings and other coordinating activities are required to keep everyone in sync. There are economies of scale up to a point, but beyond a workgroup of, say, 20 employees, diseconomies of scale begin to take over.

name.text: q017 Explain how diseconomies of scale can affect systems development.

questiontext.text: Explain how diseconomies of scale can affect systems development.

graderinfo.text: Unfortunately, as development teams become larger, the average contribution per worker decreases. This is true because, as staff size increases, more meetings and other coordinating activities are required to keep everyone in sync. There are economies of scale up to a point, but beyond a workgroup of, say, 20 employees, diseconomies of scale begin to take over. Brooks' Law points out a related problem: The addition of more people to a late project makes the project later. Brooks' Law is true not only because a larger staff requires increased coordination, but also because new people need training. The only people who can train the new employees are the existing team members, who are thus taken off productive tasks. The costs of training new people can overwhelm the benefit of their contribution.

name.text: q018 The ________ is the traditional process used to develop information systems

questiontext.text: The ________ is the traditional process used to develop information systems.

name.text: q019 Which of the following is the first phase of the systems development life c

questiontext.text: Which of the following is the first phase of the systems development life cycle?

name.text: q020 In the ________ phase of the systems development life cycle, developers use

questiontext.text: In the ________ phase of the systems development life cycle, developers use management's statement of the system needs in order to develop a new information system.

name.text: q021 In which of the following phases of the systems development life cycle do d

questiontext.text: In which of the following phases of the systems development life cycle do developers identify the particular features and functions of a new system?

name.text: q022 The project plan resulting from system definition is the input for requirem

questiontext.text: The project plan resulting from system definition is the input for requirement analysis.

name.text: q023 The goals and scope of a new information system are determined during the r

questiontext.text: The goals and scope of a new information system are determined during the requirements analysis phase of the systems development life cycle.

name.text: q024 The description of fixes and new requirements is the input to a system main

questiontext.text: The description of fixes and new requirements is the input to a system maintenance phase of a systems development life cycle.

name.text: q025 What are the five phases of the systems development life cycle (SDLC)?

questiontext.text: What are the five phases of the systems development life cycle (SDLC)?

graderinfo.text: The five phases of the systems development life cycle are (1) system definition, (2) requirements analysis, (3) component design, (4) implementation, and (5) system maintenance. Developers in the first SDLC phase, i.e. system definition, use management's statement of the system needs in order to begin to define the new system (for PRIDE, this statement is based on experience with the prototype). The resulting project plan is the input to the second phase, requirements analysis. Here developers identify the particular features and functions of the new system. The output of that phase is a set of approved user requirements, which become the primary input used to design system components. In phase 4, developers implement, test, and install the new system. Over time, users will find errors, mistakes, and problems. They will also develop new requirements. The description of fixes and new requirements is input into a system maintenance phase. The maintenance phase starts the process all over again, which is why the process is considered a cycle.

name.text: q026 Which of the following is the first step in defining a new information syst

questiontext.text: Which of the following is the first step in defining a new information system?

answer.text: assess the feasibility of the project
explain the goals and scope of the project
determine the schedule and budget for the project

name.text: q027 Which of the following steps in the systems definition process aims to elim

questiontext.text: Which of the following steps in the systems definition process aims to eliminate obviously nonsensible projects?

answer.text: define the system goals and scope

name.text: q028 ________ feasibility concerns whether a new information system fits within

questiontext.text: ________ feasibility concerns whether a new information system fits within a company's customs, culture, charter, or legal requirements.

name.text: q029 During requirements definition, a development team's composition will be ty

questiontext.text: During requirements definition, a development team's composition will be typically heavy with ________.

name.text: q030 Which of the following statements is TRUE of the composition of a developme

questiontext.text: Which of the following statements is TRUE of the composition of a development team over the different phases of the systems development life cycle?

answer.text: During conversion, the team will be heavy with database designers.
During requirements definition, the team will be heavy with testers and database designers.
During integrated testing and conversion, the team will be augmented with business users.
During design and implementation, the team will be augmented with business users.

name.text: q031 During design and implementation, a development team will be heavy with ___

questiontext.text: During design and implementation, a development team will be heavy with ________.

name.text: q032 The cost feasibility of a systems development project depends on the scope

questiontext.text: The cost feasibility of a systems development project depends on the scope of the project.

name.text: q033 Organizational feasibility refers to estimating the time it will take to co

questiontext.text: Organizational feasibility refers to estimating the time it will take to complete a project.

name.text: q034 A development team's composition changes over time.

questiontext.text: A development team's composition changes over time.

name.text: q035 Business analysts integrate the work of the programmers, testers, and users

questiontext.text: Business analysts integrate the work of the programmers, testers, and users.

name.text: q036 Explain the tasks performed during the system definition phase of the syste

questiontext.text: Explain the tasks performed during the system definition phase of the systems development life cycle.

graderinfo.text: The first step is to define the goals and scope of the new information system. At this step, a development team defines the goal and purpose of the new system. A project's scope is defined by specifying the users who will be involved, or the business processes that will be involved, or the plants, offices, and factories that will be involved. The next step is to assess feasibility. This step answers the question, "Does this project make sense?" The aim here is to eliminate obviously nonsensible projects before forming a project development team and investing significant labor. Feasibility has four dimensions: cost, schedule, technical, and organizational. If the defined project is determined to be feasible, the next step is to form the project team. Typical personnel on a development team are a manager, systems analysts, business analysts, programmers, software testers, and users. The first major task for the assembled project team is to plan the project. Members of the project team specify tasks to be accomplished, assign personnel, determine task dependencies, and set schedules.

name.text: q037 Define the terms cost feasibility, technical feasibility, and organizationa

questiontext.text: Define the terms cost feasibility, technical feasibility, and organizational feasibility.

graderinfo.text: Cost feasibility approximates total costs and compares it to system value. Technical feasibility refers to whether existing information technology is likely to be able to meet the needs of the new system. Organizational feasibility concerns whether the new system fits within the organization's customs, culture, charter, or legal requirements.

name.text: q038 Who are the members of a systems project team? Explain the roles of busines

questiontext.text: Who are the members of a systems project team? Explain the roles of business analysts and systems analysts.

graderinfo.text: Typical personnel on a development team are a manager (or managers for larger projects), business analysts, systems analysts, programmers, software testers, and users. Business analysts specialize in understanding business needs, strategies, and goals and helping businesses implement systems to accomplish their competitive strategies. Systems analysts are IT professionals who understand both business and technology. Systems analysts are closer to IT and are a bit more technical, though there is considerable overlap in the duties and responsibilities of business and systems analysts. Both are active throughout the systems development process and play a key role in moving a project through the systems development process. Business analysts work more with managers and executives; systems analysts integrate the work of the programmers, testers, and users. Depending on the nature of the project, the team may also include hardware and communications specialists, database designers and administrators, and other IT specialists.

name.text: q039 Which of the following is the most important phase in the SDLC?

questiontext.text: Which of the following is the most important phase in the SDLC?

answer.text: define the goals and scope of the new information system
adapt systems to changes in requirements

name.text: q040 If a new system involves a new database or substantial changes to an existi

questiontext.text: If a new system involves a new database or substantial changes to an existing database, then the development team will have to create a(n) ________.

name.text: q041 The easiest and cheapest time to alter an information system is in the ____

questiontext.text: The easiest and cheapest time to alter an information system is in the ________ phase of the systems development life cycle.

name.text: q042 Which of the following is a typical concern for developers while using prot

questiontext.text: Which of the following is a typical concern for developers while using prototypes?

answer.text: comparing a system's features with requirements
developing a uniform funding solution for the system

name.text: q043 Interviews are conducted with system users in the requirements analysis pha

questiontext.text: Interviews are conducted with system users in the requirements analysis phase of the systems development life cycle.

name.text: q044 The security needs of an information system are determined during the compo

questiontext.text: The security needs of an information system are determined during the component design phase of the systems development life cycle.

name.text: q045 Mock-ups of forms and reports can generate similar benefits as a working pr

questiontext.text: Mock-ups of forms and reports can generate similar benefits as a working prototype.

name.text: q046 Explain the importance of the requirements analysis phase of the systems de

questiontext.text: Explain the importance of the requirements analysis phase of the systems development life cycle (SDLC).

graderinfo.text: Determining the system's requirements is the most important phase in the systems development process. If the requirements are wrong, the system will be wrong. If the requirements are determined completely and correctly, then design and implementation will be easier and more likely to result in success. Examples of requirements are the contents and the format of Web pages and the functions of buttons on those pages, or the structure and content of a report, or the fields and menu choices in a data entry form. Security is another important category of requirements. The easiest and cheapest time to alter the information system is in the requirements phase. Changing a requirement at this stage is simply a matter of changing a description. Changing a requirement in the implementation phase may require weeks of reworking applications components and the database.

name.text: q047 While designing ________, a development team must produce design documentat

questiontext.text: While designing ________, a development team must produce design documentation for writing program code.

name.text: q048 Normal processing procedures for operations personnel involve procedures fo

questiontext.text: Normal processing procedures for operations personnel involve procedures for ________.

answer.text: continuing operations when the system fails
backing up data and other resources
using the system to accomplish business tasks
starting, stopping, and operating the system

name.text: q049 Procedures for a business information system are designed usually by ______

questiontext.text: Procedures for a business information system are designed usually by ________.

name.text: q050 In terms of software design for custom-developed programs, a development te

questiontext.text: In terms of software design for custom-developed programs, a development team identifies off-the-shelf products and then determines the alterations required.

name.text: q051 Explain how the software component of an information system is designed.

questiontext.text: Explain how the software component of an information system is designed.

graderinfo.text: Software design depends on the source of the programs. For off-the-shelf software, the team must determine candidate products and evaluate them against the requirements. For off-the-shelf with alteration software, the team identifies products to be acquired off-the-shelf and then determines the alterations required. For custom-developed programs, the team produces design documentation for writing program code. For a cloud-based system, one important design decision is where application processing will occur. All can occur on mobile devices, all can occur on cloud servers, or a mixture can be used.

name.text: q052 During the ________ phase of the systems development life cycle process, de

questiontext.text: During the ________ phase of the systems development life cycle process, developers construct, install, and test the components of the information system.

name.text: q053 A comprehensive test plan should ________.

questiontext.text: A comprehensive test plan should ________.

answer.text: not include incorrect actions that users take
cause every line of program code to be executed
cause only critical error messages to be displayed
be constructed by only product quality assurance (PQA) personnel

name.text: q054 Which of the following personnel in a development team has the final say on

questiontext.text: Which of the following personnel in a development team has the final say on whether a system is ready for use?

name.text: q055 ________ testing is the process of allowing future system users to try out

questiontext.text: ________ testing is the process of allowing future system users to try out a new system on their own.

name.text: q056 System ________ refers to the process of changing business activity from an

questiontext.text: System ________ refers to the process of changing business activity from an old information system to a new system.

name.text: q057 In a ________ installation, an organization implements an entire system on

questiontext.text: In a ________ installation, an organization implements an entire system on a limited portion of the business.

name.text: q058 In a ________ installation, a new system runs alongside the old one until t

questiontext.text: In a ________ installation, a new system runs alongside the old one until the new one has been tested and is fully operational.

name.text: q059 Olive Inc., a chain of retail outlets, is converting its existing billing s

questiontext.text: Olive Inc., a chain of retail outlets, is converting its existing billing systems to a more robust online tool. In this process, the organization runs both the old and the new systems to compare their performances. In this case, the company is implementing the new system using ________ installation.

name.text: q060 Which of the following is the most expensive style of system conversion?

questiontext.text: Which of the following is the most expensive style of system conversion?

name.text: q061 Which of the following styles of system conversion shuts off the old system

questiontext.text: Which of the following styles of system conversion shuts off the old system and starts a new system?

name.text: q062 Testing is often called product quality assurance (PQA).

questiontext.text: Testing is often called product quality assurance (PQA).

name.text: q063 Beta testing is the last phase of a testing process.

questiontext.text: Beta testing is the last phase of a testing process.

name.text: q064 In pilot installation, a new system is installed in phases across an organi

questiontext.text: In pilot installation, a new system is installed in phases across an organization.

name.text: q065 Plunge installation is sometimes called direct installation.

questiontext.text: Plunge installation is sometimes called direct installation.

name.text: q066 What is a test plan?

questiontext.text: What is a test plan?

graderinfo.text: Once developers have constructed and tested all of the system components, they integrate the individual components and test the system. Software and system testing are difficult, time-consuming, and complex tasks. Developers need to design and develop test plans and record the results of tests. A test plan consists of sequences of actions that users will take when using the new system. Test plans include not only the normal actions that users will take, but also incorrect actions. A comprehensive test plan should cause every line of program code to be executed. The test plan should cause every error message to be displayed.

name.text: q067 What is beta testing?

questiontext.text: What is beta testing?

graderinfo.text: Beta testing is the process of allowing future system users to try out the new system on their own. Software vendors, such as Microsoft, often release beta versions of their products for users to try and to test. Such users report problems back to the vendor. Beta testing is the last stage of testing. Normally, products in the beta test phase are complete and fully functioning; they typically have few serious errors.

name.text: q068 What are the four ways in which organizations can implement a system conver

questiontext.text: What are the four ways in which organizations can implement a system conversion?

graderinfo.text: Organizations can implement a system conversion in one of four ways. In a pilot installation, an organization implements the entire system on a limited portion of the business. In a phased installation, a new system is installed in phases across the organization. With parallel installation, a new system runs in parallel with the old one until the new system is tested and fully operational. The final style of conversion is plunge installation (sometimes called direct installation). With it, an organization shuts off the old system and starts the new system.

name.text: q069 Software developers group the fixes for high-priority failures into a group

questiontext.text: Software developers group the fixes for high-priority failures into a group that can be applied to all copies of a given product called a ________.

name.text: q070 Software vendors usually bundle fixes of low-priority problems into larger

questiontext.text: Software vendors usually bundle fixes of low-priority problems into larger groups called ________.

name.text: q071 Which of the following statements is TRUE of system maintenance?

questiontext.text: Which of the following statements is TRUE of system maintenance?

answer.text: Software developers usually bundle fixes for low-priority problems into a patch.
Information systems (IS) personnel prioritize system problems on a first-come-first-served basis.
All commercial software products are shipped with known failures.
Service packs are developed to fix a single problem at a time.

name.text: q072 The maintenance phase can start another cycle of the systems development li

questiontext.text: The maintenance phase can start another cycle of the systems development life cycle (SLDC).

name.text: q073 What are the tasks of system maintenance?

questiontext.text: What are the tasks of system maintenance?

graderinfo.text: The last phase of the systems development life cycle (SDLC) is maintenance. Maintenance is a misnomer; the work done during this phase is either to fix the system so that it works correctly or to adapt it to changes in requirements. First, there needs to be a means for tracking both failures and requests for enhancements to meet new requirements. For small systems, organizations can track failures and enhancements using word-processing documents. Typically, IS personnel prioritize system problems according to their severity. They fix high-priority items as soon as possible, and they fix low-priority items as time and resources become available.

name.text: q074 What are patches and service packs?

questiontext.text: What are patches and service packs?

graderinfo.text: Patches are group fixes for high priority failures that can be applied to all copies of a given product. Software vendors supply patches to fix security and other critical problems. They usually bundle fixes of low-priority problems into larger groups called service packs. Users apply service packs in much the same way that they apply patches, except that service packs typically involve fixes to hundreds or thousands of problems.

name.text: q075 Which of the following is a major concern for developers in a systems devel

questiontext.text: Which of the following is a major concern for developers in a systems development life cycle process?

answer.text: having to work with a team of specialists
moving through the unstructured phases of the cycle
agreeing on the basic tasks to be performed to build a system
performing repetitive tasks of a completed phase

name.text: q076 Projects are said to be in analysis paralysis if so much time is spent ____

questiontext.text: Projects are said to be in analysis paralysis if so much time is spent ________.

answer.text: in the system definition phase of the systems development life cycle (SDLC)

name.text: q077 The systems development life cycle process is supposed to operate in a sequ

questiontext.text: The systems development life cycle process is supposed to operate in a sequence of nonrepetitive phases.

name.text: q078 Actual systems development generally works in accordance with the waterfall

questiontext.text: Actual systems development generally works in accordance with the waterfall nature of the systems development life cycle.

name.text: q079 Estimates of labor hours and completion dates are accurate for large, multi

questiontext.text: Estimates of labor hours and completion dates are accurate for large, multiyear projects.

name.text: q080 Explain the problems caused due to the waterfall nature of the systems deve

questiontext.text: Explain the problems caused due to the waterfall nature of the systems development life cycle.

graderinfo.text: One of the reasons for SDLC problems is due to the waterfall nature of the SDLC. Like a series of waterfalls, the process is supposed to operate in a sequence of nonrepetitive phases. For example, the team completes the requirements phase and goes over the waterfall into the design phase, and on through the process. Unfortunately, systems development seldom works so smoothly. Often, there is a need to crawl back up the waterfall, if you will, and repeat work in a prior phase. Most commonly, when design work begins and the team evaluates alternatives, they learn that some requirements statements are incomplete or missing. At that point, the team needs to do more requirements work, yet that phase is supposedly finished. On some projects, the team goes back and forth between requirements and design so many times that the project seems to be out of control.

name.text: q081 Systems development is exclusively a technical task.

questiontext.text: Systems development is exclusively a technical task.

name.text: q085 All of the following are major challenges in systems development EXCEPT ___

name.text: q086 Systems development does not have to worry about requirement changes.

questiontext.text: Systems development does not have to worry about requirement changes.

name.text: q095 If the requirements are wrong, the system should be changed.

questiontext.text: If the requirements are wrong, the system should be changed.

questiontext.text: Describe the ways a team can determine hardware specifications.

graderinfo.text: For hardware, the team determines specifications for the hardware it needs and the source of that hardware. It can purchase the hardware, lease it, or lease time from a hosting service in the cloud.

name.text: q099 New information systems sometimes require new jobs.

questiontext.text: New information systems sometimes require new jobs.

name.text: q100 The budget was tight when the project entered the testing phase so Bob deci

name.text: q102 System testing is the easiest part of the implementation process since test

questiontext.text: System testing is the easiest part of the implementation process since testing has been completed at the individual level.

name.text: q103 All commercial products are shipped with known failures.

questiontext.text: All commercial products are shipped with known failures.

name.text: q104 All of these statements are true about the maintenance phase EXCEPT _______

name.text: q105 Because enhancements are adaptation of new requirements, developers usually

fix the old issues before analyzing the new issues

name.text: q106 When developing a budget for a large, multi-year projects estimations are _

name.text: q108 On some projects, the team goes back and forth between requirements and des

questiontext.text: On some projects, the team goes back and forth between requirements and design so many times the project appears to be out of control.

name.text: q109 If your department does not have appropriate procedures and trained personn

questiontext.text: If your department does not have appropriate procedures and trained personnel, you must take corrective action.

name.text: q110 According to ________ the costs of training new people can overwhelm the be

questiontext.text: According to ________ the costs of training new people can overwhelm the benefit of their contribution?

name.text: q111 Over time, users will find errors, mistakes, and problems. They will also d

questiontext.text: Over time, users will find errors, mistakes, and problems. They will also develop new requirements. The description of fixes and new requirements is input into a system maintenance phase.

name.text: q112 The first major task of an assembled team is to ________.

questiontext.text: The first major task of an assembled team is to ________.

name.text: q113 What is the role of a prototype?

questiontext.text: What is the role of a prototype?

graderinfo.text: Because requirements are difficult to specify, building a working prototype, can be quite beneficial. Whereas future systems users often struggle to understand and relate to requirements expressed as word descriptions and sketches, working with a prototype provides direct experience. As they work with a prototype, users will assess usability and remember features and functions they have forgotten to mention. Additionally, prototypes provide evidence to assess the system's technical and organizational feasibility. Further, prototypes create data that can be used to estimate both development and operational costs.

name.text: q114 Thinking about the five components, what occurs in software design when man

questiontext.text: Thinking about the five components, what occurs in software design when managing a project?

graderinfo.text: Software design depends on the source of the programs. For off-the-shelf software, the team must determine candidate products and evaluate them against the requirements. For off-the shelf-with-alteration software, the team identifies products to be acquired off-the-shelf and then determines the alterations required. For custom-developed programs, the team produces design documentation for writing program code.

name.text: q115 A ________ consists of sequences of actions that users will take when using

questiontext.text: A ________ consists of sequences of actions that users will take when using the new system.

name.text: q116 What is the first task of the maintenance phase?

questiontext.text: What is the first task of the maintenance phase?

answer.text: To send the application back to the testing team.
Track failures and obtain feedback for new requirements.

name.text: q117 Briefly, define analysis paralysis.

questiontext.text: Briefly, define analysis paralysis.

graderinfo.text: Projects that spend too much time documenting requirements hurt, not help, the SDLC process.

category.text: $course$/Experiencing MIS, 9e (Kroenke)/013 Chapter Extension 1 Introduction to Microsoft Excel 2019

name.text: q001 Nancy, a teacher, creates a table using Excel to list the number of student

questiontext.text: Nancy, a teacher, creates a table using Excel to list the number of students in her class. She uses rows and columns to add subject names and the grades received by each student. Nancy's table is also called a ________.

name.text: q002 In an Excel spreadsheet, rows are identified by ________.

questiontext.text: In an Excel spreadsheet, rows are identified by ________.

name.text: q003 In an Excel spreadsheet, columns are identified by ________.

questiontext.text: In an Excel spreadsheet, columns are identified by ________.

name.text: q004 In Excel, a single spreadsheet is known as a ________.

questiontext.text: In Excel, a single spreadsheet is known as a ________.

name.text: q005 In Excel, the intersection of a row and a column is called a ________.

questiontext.text: In Excel, the intersection of a row and a column is called a ________.

name.text: q006 An Excel workbook is a collection of one or more worksheets.

questiontext.text: An Excel workbook is a collection of one or more worksheets.

name.text: q007 Excel creates multiple worksheets when a new workbook is created.

questiontext.text: Excel creates multiple worksheets when a new workbook is created.

name.text: q008 Each cell in an Excel spreadsheet is identified by the data entered in it.

questiontext.text: Each cell in an Excel spreadsheet is identified by the data entered in it.

name.text: q009 What is a spreadsheet?

questiontext.text: What is a spreadsheet?

graderinfo.text: A spreadsheet is a table of data having rows and columns. The rows are identified by numbers, and the columns are identified by letters. The term spreadsheet almost always refers to an electronic spreadsheet, and most frequently to a spreadsheet that is processed by Microsoft Excel. Electronic spreadsheets provide incredible labor savings over paper spreadsheets and were a major factor in the early adoption of personal computers. In Excel, the term worksheet refers to a spreadsheet. One or more worksheets are combined to form a workbook.

name.text: q010 Explain the process of naming the rows, columns, and cells in Microsoft Exc

questiontext.text: Explain the process of naming the rows, columns, and cells in Microsoft Excel.

graderinfo.text: Excel spreadsheets have rows and columns. The rows are identified by numbers, and the columns are identified by letters. Because there are only 26 letters in the alphabet, the following scheme is used to label columns: The letters A through Z identify the first 26 columns; the letters AA through AZ identify the next 26; BA through BZ the next 26; and so forth. The intersection of a row and a column is called a cell. Each cell is identified by the name of its row and column. For example, cell K5 is situated in the column K and row number 5.

name.text: q011 In Excel, the wide bar of tools and selections that appears just under the

questiontext.text: In Excel, the wide bar of tools and selections that appears just under the tabs is called the ________.

name.text: q012 Joe is working on a business presentation on his company's sales figures fo

questiontext.text: Joe is working on a business presentation on his company's sales figures for the previous quarter. He needs to add a graph to his Excel worksheet showing the difference in sales figures of different quarters. Which of the following tabs will Joe use to add the graph?

name.text: q013 In Excel, which of the following tabs is used for filtering and sorting inf

questiontext.text: In Excel, which of the following tabs is used for filtering and sorting information in a spreadsheet?

name.text: q014 In Excel, the REVIEW tab is used for ________.

questiontext.text: In Excel, the REVIEW tab is used for ________.

name.text: q015 The ________ tab is used for configuring the appearance of Excel.

questiontext.text: The ________ tab is used for configuring the appearance of Excel.

name.text: q016 In Excel, the most frequently used tools and selections appear under the __

questiontext.text: In Excel, the most frequently used tools and selections appear under the ________ tab.

name.text: q017 To save a worksheet in Excel, the Save option in the Edit menu is used.

questiontext.text: To save a worksheet in Excel, the Save option in the Edit menu is used.

name.text: q018 In Excel, a sequence of tabs that appear in a horizontal line, just below t

questiontext.text: In Excel, a sequence of tabs that appear in a horizontal line, just below the Excel icon, controls the contents of the ribbon.

name.text: q019 In Excel, when the HOME tab is selected, the contents of the ribbon concern

questiontext.text: In Excel, when the HOME tab is selected, the contents of the ribbon concern charts, filter, tables, and so forth.

name.text: q020 In Excel, the PAGE LAYOUT tab is used to format a page, often for printing.

questiontext.text: In Excel, the PAGE LAYOUT tab is used to format a page, often for printing.

name.text: q021 For general work in Excel spreadsheets, the tools and selection under the D

questiontext.text: For general work in Excel spreadsheets, the tools and selection under the DATA tab are most useful.

name.text: q022 In Excel, the FORMULAS tab is used for creating complex formulas.

questiontext.text: In Excel, the FORMULAS tab is used for creating complex formulas.

name.text: q023 A user enters a formula into cell G9. Which of the following would be possi

questiontext.text: A user enters a formula into cell G9. Which of the following would be possible if the user presses the F2 function key after selecting the cell G9?

answer.text: The formula in G9 can be edited without retyping the entire formula.
The formula can be copied to the clipboard.
A graph can be created based on the cells that appear in the formula.
The formula in the cell can be locked.

name.text: q024 If a user enters the value 100 into cell G1, presses Enter, and then clicks

questiontext.text: If a user enters the value 100 into cell G1, presses Enter, and then clicks the cell G1, a rectangle will be drawn around the cell with a little black box in the lower right-hand corner. Which of the following occurs if the user drags that little black box down to cell G7?

answer.text: Excel will display values that progressively increase by 100 in each of those cells.
All of those cells will remain blank.
Excel will display the value 100 in all of those cells.
All of those cells' values will be multiplied by 100.

name.text: q025 Which of the following keys is used to edit the value in a cell without ret

questiontext.text: Which of the following keys is used to edit the value in a cell without retyping the whole entry?

name.text: q026 If a user enters "jan" and "feb" in cells E1 and E2, respectively, selects

questiontext.text: If a user enters "jan" and "feb" in cells E1 and E2, respectively, selects those two cells and drags the small black box to three more cells below them, then ________.

answer.text: the three cells will remain empty
Excel will display an error message
the three cells will display "jan," "feb," and "jan," respectively
the three cells will display "mar," "apr," and "may," respectively

name.text: q027 Data can be imported to Excel from other programs.

questiontext.text: Data can be imported to Excel from other programs.

name.text: q028 Excel lacks features that can add data into a spreadsheet based on a patter

questiontext.text: Excel lacks features that can add data into a spreadsheet based on a pattern.

name.text: q029 If the months of a year are entered in the text form, then Excel does not r

questiontext.text: If the months of a year are entered in the text form, then Excel does not recognize them as a pattern.

name.text: q030 Using the F2 function key is recommended when a user has a long value in a

questiontext.text: Using the F2 function key is recommended when a user has a long value in a cell and wants to edit a letter or two without retyping the whole entry.

name.text: q031 What are the different ways of entering data into an Excel worksheet?

questiontext.text: What are the different ways of entering data into an Excel worksheet?

graderinfo.text:
Data can be entered into an Excel worksheet in three ways:
1. Key in the required data–to key in the required data, click on the cell in which the data is to be added, type the data, and press Enter.
2. Let Excel add data based on a pattern–to add data based on a pattern, enter values based on the pattern in one or more cells, select the cell(s), and drag the mouse to the required number of cells.
3. Import data from another program–data can be entered into an Excel worksheet by importing data from another program such as Microsoft Access.

name.text: q032 Which of the following is TRUE of the options for modifying rows and column

questiontext.text: Which of the following is TRUE of the options for modifying rows and columns in Excel?

answer.text: To add a column, click the name of the column before which new columns are needed and select as many columns to the right as required.
To increase the size of a column, drag the line between the two columns in the column headings to the left.
To insert new rows, click the number of the row below which new rows are needed and select as many rows below as required.
To decrease the height of a row, drag the line between the line numbers down.

name.text: q033 In Excel, to insert new rows, click the number of the row above which new r

questiontext.text: In Excel, to insert new rows, click the number of the row above which new rows need to be added, and then select the number of rows to be added.

name.text: q034 In Excel, an entire row or column can be selected by clicking the name of t

questiontext.text: In Excel, an entire row or column can be selected by clicking the name of the row or column.

name.text: q035 Explain the process of inserting rows and columns in Microsoft Excel.

questiontext.text: Explain the process of inserting rows and columns in Microsoft Excel.

graderinfo.text: To insert new rows in Microsoft Excel, click the number of the row above which new rows are to be inserted and select as many rows as required, left-click, and then select Insert. The new rows would be inserted above the selected row. To add columns in Microsoft Excel, click the name of the column before which new columns are to be inserted, select as many columns to the right as required, right-click, and then select Insert.

name.text: q036 The ________ section of the ribbon in Excel enables selected text to be cen

questiontext.text: The ________ section of the ribbon in Excel enables selected text to be centered both horizontally and vertically in a cell.

name.text: q037 Selecting the $ English (U.S.) option displays numbers with a dollar sign a

questiontext.text: Selecting the $ English (U.S.) option displays numbers with a dollar sign and two decimal places.

name.text: q038 Rachel is working on a spreadsheet to calculate financial ratios. She tabul

questiontext.text: Rachel is working on a spreadsheet to calculate financial ratios. She tabulates the values and begins creating a formula to calculate the ratios. Which of the following signs should Rachel remember to use at the beginning of her formula?
In Excel, ________.

answer.text: an entire row cannot be deleted, but an entire column can be deleted
only numbers are recognized as patterns used to fill data
a formula that does not start with an equal sign is considered as a text value

name.text: q040 In an Excel sheet, what is the meaning of the formula =SUM(C3:C8)?

questiontext.text: In an Excel sheet, what is the meaning of the formula =SUM(C3:C8)?

answer.text: Add all the values starting from the third cell to eighth cell in the third column.
Add all the values starting from the third cell to eighth cell in the third row.
Add the value of the third cell in the third column to the eighth cell in the third column.
Add the value of the third cell in the third row to the eighth cell in the third row.

name.text: q041 Whenever users have a problem with a calculation in Excel, they can press F

questiontext.text: Whenever users have a problem with a calculation in Excel, they can press F2 to highlight the cells involved in that calculation.

name.text: q042 While copying a formula, Excel can adjust the terms of the formula to refer

questiontext.text: While copying a formula, Excel can adjust the terms of the formula to refer to the cells, in the row to which it is copied.

name.text: q043 The real power of Excel lies in its amazing computational capability. Expla

questiontext.text: The real power of Excel lies in its amazing computational capability. Explain.

graderinfo.text: Excel can be used to work with a number of built-in and user-created formulas. It has a system in place to highlight areas that need to be corrected and to assign color codes to the cells so that a user can easily see which cells are being used in a given formula. Excel also has the capability to copy formulas and adjust the terms of the formula so that each would refer to cells in the row to which it was copied. Finally, it has a number of preprogrammed activities that allow users to sum figures, average figures, and perform many other calculations by selecting a choice from the Formulas tab.

name.text: q044 Angelo's spreadsheet has more columns than rows therefore he wants a sidewa

questiontext.text: Angelo's spreadsheet has more columns than rows therefore he wants a sideways or Landscape print of the sheet. His secretary, however, gets an upright print. Angelo asks his secretary to take another print because he was unhappy with the ________.

name.text: q045 Which of the following is TRUE of the printing option in Excel spreadsheets

questiontext.text: Which of the following is TRUE of the printing option in Excel spreadsheets?

answer.text: Gridlines can only be viewed in the print preview and cannot be printed.
Print Preview is present in the Review tab.
Landscape orientation prints a worksheet upright.
Print area can be used to specify the portion of the spreadsheet to be printed.

name.text: q046 The tools and selections in the PAGE LAYOUT ribbon determine how a document

questiontext.text: The tools and selections in the PAGE LAYOUT ribbon determine how a document will be arranged as a printed document.

name.text: q047 If a spreadsheet is printed sideways on a page, the orientation is said to

questiontext.text: If a spreadsheet is printed sideways on a page, the orientation is said to be portrait.

name.text: q048 The portion of the spreadsheet to be printed can be specified using margins

questiontext.text: The portion of the spreadsheet to be printed can be specified using margins.

name.text: q049 If you are learning Excel it is best to begin with the previous version.

questiontext.text: If you are learning Excel it is best to begin with the previous version.

name.text: q050 John is working in Excel and notices that his rows are numbering past 2000.

questiontext.text: John is working in Excel and notices that his rows are numbering past 2000. What would be the best action in this situation?

answer.text: Break the sheet into different workbooks.
Delete the data even if it is necessary.
Just keep adding data, Excel is limitless.

name.text: q051 Which tab holds the most frequently used tools and selections?

questiontext.text: Which tab holds the most frequently used tools and selections?

name.text: q052 Excel can only locate patterns within numbers.

questiontext.text: Excel can only locate patterns within numbers.

name.text: q053 You cannot add a row or column to excel if there is data in the cell.

questiontext.text: You cannot add a row or column to excel if there is data in the cell.

name.text: q054 Excel has a one way to format the spreadsheet.

questiontext.text: Excel has a one way to format the spreadsheet.

name.text: q055 If you want to use a formula in a different cell you have to input it again

questiontext.text: If you want to use a formula in a different cell you have to input it again.

name.text: q056 Which of the following is an incorrect formula in Excel?

questiontext.text: Which of the following is an incorrect formula in Excel?

name.text: q057 Excel spreadsheets can only be printed with gridlines visible.

questiontext.text: Excel spreadsheets can only be printed with gridlines visible.

name.text: q058 Excel gives you an unlimited number of rows and columns.

questiontext.text: Excel gives you an unlimited number of rows and columns.

name.text: q059 Which tab would you use add a picture to the Excel worksheet?

questiontext.text: Which tab would you use add a picture to the Excel worksheet?

name.text: q060 When you click the name of a row you are selecting the entire row.

questiontext.text: When you click the name of a row you are selecting the entire row.

name.text: q061 What is the best action to take if you do not know how to accomplish a task

questiontext.text: What is the best action to take if you do not know how to accomplish a task in Excel?

answer.text: Click the question mark in the upper right-hand corner.
Attempt to complete the tasks in a different way.

name.text: q062 What is the real power of Excel?

questiontext.text: What is the real power of Excel?

answer.text: The ability to change the form of the spreadsheet.
The flexible way you can format data.

name.text: q063 What is the best tip for saving paper and ink in Excel?

questiontext.text: What is the best tip for saving paper and ink in Excel?

answer.text: Change the arrangement of the page in page layout.
Break the worksheet into smaller workbooks.

category.text: $course$/Experiencing MIS, 9e (Kroenke)/014 Chapter Extension 2 Artificial Intelligence and Automation

name.text: q001 ________ is the ability of a machine to simulate human abilities such as vi

questiontext.text: ________ is the ability of a machine to simulate human abilities such as vision, communication and learning in order to achieve a goal.

name.text: q002 Artificial Intelligence can be used to increase ________ or the process of

questiontext.text: Artificial Intelligence can be used to increase ________ or the process of making systems operation without human intervention.

name.text: q003 ________ is the ability of a machine to simulate human abilities such as vi

questiontext.text: ________ is the ability of a machine to simulate human abilities such as vision, communication and learning in order to achieve a goal.

name.text: q004 When artificial intelligence was being researched, the field developed a ba

questiontext.text: When artificial intelligence was being researched, the field developed a bad reputation.

name.text: q005 List the six forces driving artificial intelligence innovation.

questiontext.text: List the six forces driving artificial intelligence innovation.

graderinfo.text: Increases in computing power. Availability of large datasets for training. Cloud scalability and applications. Increased device connectivity. New AI techniques. Practical AI applications.

name.text: q006 ________ has helped with increased AI usage because AI requires large amoun

questiontext.text: ________ has helped with increased AI usage because AI requires large amounts of rich data to use and it is now available.

name.text: q007 ________ has greatly increased the accuracy and practical usefulness of AI.

questiontext.text: ________ has greatly increased the accuracy and practical usefulness of AI.

name.text: q008 Provide some examples of practical AI applications.

questiontext.text: Provide some examples of practical AI applications.

graderinfo.text: Answers may vary. Amazon: Alexa, Echo, Amazon Machine Learning. Facebook: DeepText, newsfeed, search rankings. Google: Google Assistant, Home, Google Brain, Openframeworks. Microsoft: Cortana, Face, Bing Image search. Apple, Siri, HomePod, iWatch.

name.text: q009 Users are sometimes unknowingly interacting with AI on a daily basis.

questiontext.text: Users are sometimes unknowingly interacting with AI on a daily basis.

name.text: q010 Which of the following forces is providing vast amounts of data for AI appl

questiontext.text: Which of the following forces is providing vast amounts of data for AI applications?

name.text: q011 A business owner must understand how AI is going to affect the organization

questiontext.text: A business owner must understand how AI is going to affect the organization.

name.text: q012 List productivity gains from automation.

questiontext.text: List productivity gains from automation.

graderinfo.text: Can work 24 hours, 365 days; immediately trained; no breaks during work hours; no impaired workers; not time-wasting activities; no accidents or injuries; no arguments with other employees or managers; no scheduling issues; all holiday shifts covered, and more accurate, precise, and consistent.

name.text: q013 All of these costs are true of human employees EXCEPT ________.

questiontext.text: All of these costs are true of human employees EXCEPT ________.

name.text: q014 Which of the following is a benefit of AI?

questiontext.text: Which of the following is a benefit of AI?

name.text: q015 All of these costs are examples of employee fraud EXCEPT ________.

questiontext.text: All of these costs are examples of employee fraud EXCEPT ________.

name.text: q016 There are two distinct reactions to AI. Those who see it as an opportunity

questiontext.text: There are two distinct reactions to AI. Those who see it as an opportunity and those who see it as a threat.

name.text: q017 Jobs requiring ________ physical and mental tasks are prime candidates for

questiontext.text: Jobs requiring ________ physical and mental tasks are prime candidates for automation.

name.text: q018 Jason is looking at his budgets and decides he needs to lower labor costs.

questiontext.text: Jason is looking at his budgets and decides he needs to lower labor costs. Which task is most likely to become automated with AI?

name.text: q019 The following are all potential unwanted dirty jobs that can be completed w

questiontext.text: The following are all potential unwanted dirty jobs that can be completed with AI EXCEPT ________.

name.text: q020 With AI new types of jobs will be created.

questiontext.text: With AI new types of jobs will be created.

name.text: q021 Describe ways AI-enabled machines will need human counterparts.

questiontext.text: Describe ways AI-enabled machines will need human counterparts.

graderinfo.text: AI machines will need human workers to take care of them. AIs also need training. Machines will need humans because machines lack instinct. Machines need humans to survive and improve.

name.text: q022 Machines lack all of these skills EXCEPT ________.

questiontext.text: Machines lack all of these skills EXCEPT ________.

answer.text: the ability to define new problems

name.text: q023 ________ will always be needed for AI-enabled machines.

questiontext.text: ________ will always be needed for AI-enabled machines.

answer.text: The ability to work on instinct

name.text: q024 Jobs requiring ________ physical and mental tasks are prime candidates for

questiontext.text: Jobs requiring ________ physical and mental tasks are prime candidates for automation.

name.text: q025 Without ________ machines won't last long.

questiontext.text: Without ________ machines won't last long.

answer.text: the ability to quickly solve problems

name.text: q026 Humans and machines need each other.

questiontext.text: Humans and machines need each other.

name.text: q027 What is the goal of strong AI?

questiontext.text: What is the goal of strong AI?

answer.text: to complete all of the same tasks as humans
to complete a single specific task well
the capability of having more advanced intelligence than humans

name.text: q028 Joshua wanted to know if his AI program could be mistaken for another human

questiontext.text: Joshua wanted to know if his AI program could be mistaken for another human while interacting with a human. He wanted to see if his program could pass ________.

name.text: q029 Weak AI focuses on completing a single specific task.

questiontext.text: Weak AI focuses on completing a single specific task.

name.text: q030 We are very close to AI that displays superintelligence.

questiontext.text: We are very close to AI that displays superintelligence.

name.text: q031 All of these are examples of AI in a self-driving car EXCEPT ________.

questiontext.text: All of these are examples of AI in a self-driving car EXCEPT ________.

name.text: q032 For some companies, saying yes to AI may be painful but it is a necessary d

questiontext.text: For some companies, saying yes to AI may be painful but it is a necessary decision.

name.text: q033 Describe what types of changes companies may experience as a result of impl

questiontext.text: Describe what types of changes companies may experience as a result of implementing AI.

graderinfo.text: Answers may vary. The types of jobs that need to be filled will change. Workers will have to continually develop new skills for new jobs. Workers may find themselves doing jobs that have little to do with their formal education.

name.text: q034 Understanding AI may assist businesses with solving organizational problems

questiontext.text: Understanding AI may assist businesses with solving organizational problems.

name.text: q035 ________, a subset of AI, is the extraction of knowledge data based on algo

questiontext.text: ________, a subset of AI, is the extraction of knowledge data based on algorithms created from training data.

name.text: q036 Machines learn through experience.

questiontext.text: Machines learn through experience.

name.text: q037 Georgia is attempting to solve a mathematical problem. She chooses the corr

questiontext.text: Georgia is attempting to solve a mathematical problem. She chooses the correct procedure or ________ that best fits the situation.

name.text: q038 Sam is going to use a program that predicts the possibility of a certain ou

questiontext.text: Sam is going to use a program that predicts the possibility of a certain outcome based on prior occurrences of related events to predict if a car is most likely to run a red light. He decides to use ________.

name.text: q039 Machine learning can be used in all of the following tasks EXCEPT ________.

questiontext.text: Machine learning can be used in all of the following tasks EXCEPT ________.

name.text: q040 ________, a subset of AI, is the extraction of knowledge data based on algo

questiontext.text: ________, a subset of AI, is the extraction of knowledge data based on algorithms created from training data.

name.text: q041 As a business person it is important to know how Watson works so you can id

questiontext.text: As a business person it is important to know how Watson works so you can identify potential applications.

name.text: q042 How does Watson work?

questiontext.text: How does Watson work?

graderinfo.text: Frist Watson acquires content from sources like dictionaries, encyclopedias, literature, reports, and databases. It extracts valuable pieces of data from these sources. It adds this data to a corpus of knowledge. Once the corpus is built, it can start answering questions. Each question that comes in goes through analysis where Watson determines what king question is being asked and then analyzes the question. Next it generates a hypothesis about might be the right answer. It searches for possible candidate answer reviewing the top 250 candidates and then filters that down to top 100 answers. Finally, it merges all of the scored candidate answers, identifies the best possible answers, and estimates the probability that an answer is correct. All of this happens in about 3 seconds.

name.text: q043 How long did it take for Watson to become a trivia question champion?

questiontext.text: How long did it take for Watson to become a trivia question champion?

answer.text: Watson is not a trivia question champion.

name.text: q044 Because of Moore's law what can Watson do forever?

questiontext.text: Because of Moore's law what can Watson do forever?

answer.text: Get processor upgrades on demand that are twice as fast every eighteen months.
Be able to add new processes on demand.
Be connected to other AI machines indefinitely.

name.text: q045 ________ is the ability of a computer system to understand human language.

questiontext.text: ________ is the ability of a computer system to understand human language.

name.text: q046 XYZ Corp decides to change the process of putting widgets on a board from a

questiontext.text: XYZ Corp decides to change the process of putting widgets on a board from a human assembly to robots. XYZ Corp is ________.

name.text: q047 What is one benefit of automation?

questiontext.text: What is one benefit of automation?

name.text: q048 AI can perform some of the dirty jobs that humans do not want to do.

questiontext.text: AI can perform some of the dirty jobs that humans do not want to do.

name.text: q049 All of the following are areas of research for artificial intelligence (AI)

questiontext.text: All of the following are areas of research for artificial intelligence (AI) except ________.

name.text: q050 Watson will disappear in the future because it takes it too long to learn t

questiontext.text: Watson will disappear in the future because it takes it too long to learn things.
